title: Effect of Depth of Field and Astigmatism on Holographic Image Clarity
description: Evaluate how depth of field and astigmatism affect the clarity of a rainbow holographic image.
insight: Astigmatism results from differences in horizontal and vertical focus, creating a limited depth of field and reducing image clarity.
question_text:
In a rainbow holographic display, a hologram is viewed from a distance of $$D_{view} = 600 \, mm$$. The maximum allowable astigmatism is set to $$0.2 \, diopters$$. Determine the allowable range of depth of field (both in front of and behind the hologram) before image clarity is significantly affected by astigmatism.

Use the relationships:
$$A_1 = \frac{1}{D_{view}} - \frac{1}{D_{front}}$$ and $$A_2 = \frac{1}{D_{back}} - \frac{1}{D_{view}}$$,
where $$A_1$$ and $$A_2$$ represent the allowable astigmatism limits.

solution.final_answer: Allowable depth of field: 81 mm in front and 64 mm behind the hologram.
steps: Start with the astigmatism limit formula: $$A = 0.2 \, diopters$$.
